Description: Arab heads, one of four studies for Plate 104 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; head and shoulders of a man wearing a turban, in profile to right Pen and grey ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by the artist. There is no drawings for the first image of Plate 104. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum. See also 1836,0109.161.a
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
